page.title: 19MEDIA
page.content: Barnsley is situated within South Yorkshire and over the last year has been at the forefront of local and national media. The mining dispute and the abolition of the South Yorkshire council has caused this to be so. The town has its own newspaper, the Barnsley Chronicle which is edited and printed in the town and covers all the local issues: It is a weekly journal that is on sale on Fridays. We also have a free paper called the Independent which contains advertisements and news snippets. Added to these there is the Barnsley Star which is printed in Sheffield but carries local news items. There are no television or radio stations in our town but we are able to tune into Yorkshire T.V and the radio stations Sheffield, Leeds, Hallam and Aire.
